description: Buy the Old Town Topwater 120 PDL Kayak - 2022 online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Topwater 120 PDL Kayak - 2022
hasVariant.description: Buy the Old Town Topwater 120 PDL Kayak - 2022 online or shop all Paddle from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought this mainly for fly fishing because it seems that every time I find a nice fly fishing spot the wind keeps blowing me over where I want to fish. So now I can backpedal and hold my position while fly fishing without having to drop the fly rod to paddle backwards.

Also, I have emphysema yet I can pedal this along at a nice clip while trolling a lake or pond at 2 to 3 mph with no problem.

At 12 feet it is a big kayak and a mite on the heavy side but that all contributes to its excellent stability. I'm in my late 60's and not as agile as I use to be so I wanted a really stable kayak. If you are a young pup I'm sure you could fly fish standing up with no problem but I don't have the balance any more. However, I have tested its stability by standing up and its a rock solid fishing platform and wish I had better balance to take advantage of it.

Mounting a fish finder or rod holder is a snap with its accessory rails. 

It is also a bit pricey but like the old saying goes, "you get what you pay for" and this kayak is definitely worth the price. You will never regret buying it. 

Old Town Canoe makes great products and over the years I've bought a couple canoes and this kayak and have been extremely happy with every purchase.
review.name: Great Fishing Yak

review.reviewBody: I have used this kayak 3 times and so far (besides the weight) I can't find anything I don't like. This is a solid, well built kayak. It peddles  great, and steers effortlessly
review.name: awesome kayak

review.reviewBody: It seemed like a lot of money for a kayak. But I think it's the best kayak for the dollar.
review.name: Stable and a dry kayak

name: Topwater 120 PDL Kayak - 2022

description: Buy the BioLite BaseCharge 600+ online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: BaseCharge 600+
hasVariant.description: Buy the BioLite BaseCharge 600+ online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Excellent. Took it camping and it was amazing. Paired this with 1 solar panel 100 and never dropped below 80% battery. Even with using air pumps for beach days. May buy the larger one for more off grid camping
review.name: Perfect for camping, bush, or beach days.

review.reviewBody: I purchased the BaseCharge 600 and just plugged in a Nespresso Essenza machine and a Aerocino.  Surge wattage of Essenza showed 960w and the Aerocino was a little less.  I ran the 2 machines one after the other.  No noticeable battery consumption making 2 cappuccinos.  Also ran Resmed CPAP with heated humidifier on for 8 hr therapy and it showed 13 hr left.  It would be considerably less consumption if I turned humidifier off.  It charged my phone wireless nicely.  I plan to use this as an auxiliary battery in my RV which has a generator and lead acid house batteries.  I had difficulty with CPAP running all night on the lead acid house batteries and could not get Nespresso with 1000w inverter to work without running noisy generator.  This will be an easy upgrade without the expense of upgrading batteries to Li .  Excellent power station and very happy with this purchase.
review.name: Neapresso machine, CPAP

review.reviewBody: Amazing product. Within the first month of purchase the base charge was very useful on a week long camp trip in keeping all lights and devices fully charged. Also came in handy when the power went out overnight due to a surprise snow storm! Did experience major delays and issues when it came to shipping me the product. Issues that stretched over six weeks to resolve. Major flaw in keeping things organized and with communication.
review.name: Good times with the base charge 600!

name: BaseCharge 600+

review.reviewBody: Bought for my husband for Christmas. Not at all what we expected for the price. Returning..
review.name: Windbreaker not what we thought

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket not too long ago. I was a little skeptical about it at first. But it's a jacket I bring with me on every ride. It's also a bit warmer that I expected. And it really does pack up small. Have not tested it in the rain. But dies help with the wind for sure.
review.name: Pretty good jacket.

review.reviewBody: This jacket is extremely comfortable.  I'm 5'6" with broad shoulders and a more or less triangular shape (not a body builder by any stretch, though).  The medium fits me perfectly with room to layer.  I expect it's long enough for taller people, too.  It breaths well, provides good wind protection, and a small amount of protection from precipitation.  The first time I tried running in this jacket, the hood flopped annoyingly into my field of view.  I have since discovered that you can just fold the brim back once or twice to tighten up the fit.  This may look a little wonky, but it works beautifully, and it's the only option, since there's no drawstring adjustment on the hood.  It's very nice to have hand-warmer pockets, which many wind shells omit.
review.name: Well executed wind shell

review.reviewBody: I bought this to try out in spring/summer in Washington and it is fantastic. It's super light weight but does a great job at blocking the wind and light rain. The fit is trim but not overly loose (I got a large with a 41" chest, 6', 188 lbs). It has quickly become my go to windbreaker and has replaced my Arc'teryx Squamish hoody. Definitely worth the buy!
review.name: Great super light weight windbreaker

review.reviewBody: Love the stretch and breathability of this jacket. It works great for activities where you're exerting yourself. I'm almost always a medium, and my medium fits well except the arms are tight when raising them. If you have broad shoulders, the fit may seem a bit snug.
review.name: Nice Piece

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket, incredibly light and packable, breathes great, but still provides some nice light protection against wind or a light drizzle.
review.name: Stylish, functional and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I am an OR employee and have used prototype versions of this jacket over the past couple years. The fabric works very well at giving both wind and light weather protection AND breathability and stretch. For running, mountain biking and as an "up-hill jacket" for backcountry ski touring it is amazing because it adds warmth in cool and cold temps, but breathes enough to prevent overheating so much better than traditional windshells. And it is ultralight and highly packable. Best of all worlds. (It does not replace a rain jacket though. It is water resistant, but far from waterproof.)
review.name: Windshell with stretch breathability. You can leave it on.

name: Shadow Wind Hooded Jacket - Men's

description: Buy the Giordana G-Shield Thermal Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: G-Shield Thermal Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giordana G-Shield Thermal Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Looking to extend my road biking season, I've been hunting for a thicker pair of long-fingered gloves.  These advertise they are good for 40-60F (4-15C).  First ride (20miles) was a mix of flats/cat5 climbs, on a morning when temperature was 46F (8C) with light wind/clouds my hands were very comfortably warm.  I was also wearing bib shorts, long sleeve base layer, sun sleeves, long sleeve jersey, and thin POC beanie under my helmet.  Temperature-wise, was very happy and comfortable. 
The palm padding is quite thin, however.  Riding in grips was less comfortable than what I'm used to with fingerless gloves, especially in my left hand when shifting.  No issues riding on tops or drops, but I spend most of my ride (85-90%) in the grips.  I may double up with fingerless gloves underneath and see how that goes.
I also noticed that the finger length was long by 1/2" (~1cm), which was only an issue when trying to use my bar-mounted phone to skip songs or interface with my ride-logging app.
In summary, these are a good thickness for deep fall, very early spring but need better padding and shorter finger length.
review.name: Warm but thin padding, long fingers

name: G-Shield Thermal Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: This is a great belt and Iâ€™ve used it for short runs and longer multi day races including running in the Alps. But this is the 3rd belt Iâ€™ve had where the zip gets stuck and eventually chews a hole in the material to the side of the zip. Could the material be reinforced?
review.name: Great fit and feel but poor durability
comment:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.
We are very sorry to learn of your experience.
Please know, we hold warranty on our footwear for manufacturing defects, for 2 years since purchase date.
One of our agents will contact you regarding this matter.

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve been using my pulse belt for a few weeks now, almost daily. Itâ€™s been a long time since Iâ€™ve used any kind of running belt because I typically get annoyed with the bouncing or the rash, but honestly after the first couple of runs when you get it situated the way you like it, you wonâ€™t even know itâ€™s there! I put my wallet in the zipper compartment and soft flask with my phone(covered with a plastic bag) in the pocket area and no longer worried about my car being broken into and stuff being stolen while I get some miles in after work. I found it best to have the soft flask in the front and zipper compartment in the back. Unless you attach poles to the loops, which I havenâ€™t done yet.
review.name: Perfect fit and function!

review.reviewBody: I wasnâ€™t sure I needed a hydration vest just yet, and this belt works perfectly! It fits snuggly with zero movement on my runs and fits my car keys, a credit card, gels, and a soft flask in the back pocket.
review.name: Great fit!

review.reviewBody: Fantastic running belt to complement my larger running backpack for times when I don't go as far. It fits a 500ml flexible water pouch and my phone/keys in a separate zip pocket. Highly recommend. I'm 5'9" and 150 lbs, the medium is perfect.
review.name: Minimalist perfection

review.reviewBody: Wearing both the Salomon Advanced Skin 12 for hydration and the Salomon Pulse belt for other items (including trekking poles, gels, and my phone), I couldn't be more happy with my Salomon running gear and put it to the test during the Leadville Trail Marathon on June 29th, 2024! If you're on the bubble of sizes, select the smaller size to account for the additional weight that you might carry - also prevents any slipping down around your waist!  All in all, excellent products!!
review.name: Excellence during the Leadville Trail Marathon '24

review.reviewBody: Space for water bottle, phone, gels or even straps to hang your shirt.
review.name: Space for everything needed for long or short run!

name: Pulse Belt

review.reviewBody:
Great way to get cordelettes custom built or even for use as a static support line.

Hold the rope tight, cut with a sharp knife under tension and don't stab yourself once it goes through. Burn the ends with a standard lighter and you're good.

This is an easy rope to work with, it ties knots well and is plenty flexible to dress even the more complex multi-strand BHKs.

review.reviewBody: Loose in some areas and tight in others. My ankles hurt because I think the liners are too thin for the chicken wire they have to tighten on the inside
review.name: Pinch points

review.reviewBody: Havenâ€™t gotten to ride with these, but out of the box the feel like they would have good heel hold, and overall very comfortable could wear around the house for 30 minutes without issue. My old boots had to get tweaked cause the would make my foot fall asleep out of the box within minutes. My running shoe size is 10.5 (Sauconey/Brooks) and I got 9.5 which fit perfect with just the right amount of space between toes and end of boot.
review.name: Super comfort out of the box

review.reviewBody: Mark says he doesn't like the strap design because it he couldn't get it tight enough. It seems I can tighten past  leg pain with the strap alone, and still utilize the whole strip of velcro. I've ridden several boots. All of them have caused foot pain except for these. They stay tight all day. They are pretty soft and flexy, but I wouldn't say this is a bad thing. They offer alot for the beginner/intermediate. They keep you reliably comfortable which is what's most important in my opinion.
review.name: I disagree with Mark, boots are great!

review.reviewBody: The vans hi standard pro boots did not meet my expectations of a pro boot. Vans selling point is their looks and they are very comfortable almost to a fault. The boots hold your foot well I guess but above the ankle is almost no support. Extremely surfy feeling boots, maybe good for a skater if your into that. Only having 2 lace hooks above the ankle is horrid, the powercuff strap could not tighten the boot enough to get any support from that. The powercuff strap was different lengths on each boot so far off when tightened the velcro totally missed the other side of velcro making the strap useless. Vans sacrificed performance big time on this boot but at least they are comfy. I have 10+ years of park crew experience and would recommend the 32 tm2!
review.name: xtra mid no upper support

name: Hi-Standard Pro Snowboard Boot - 2024

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT ROAM V2 GPS Cycling Computer
review.reviewBody:
This is my second wahoo computer after years of owning the big G.   The software is simple. The display is crisp and clean and extremely readable.   I love that you can configure the menus in real time from your phone make a change and you instantly see it happen on your computer in real time    

One thing I noticed Wen riding with my friends with Garmin computer computers   This thing pops up to climb menu automatically, much better than in the Garmin   It simply looks at the road ahead and predicts if you were going straight, what is the hill profile and if you have it enabled pops up a hell profile screen   I donâ€™t know why, but all my buddies brand new Garmin were not doing it and my very simple who was  

My older element was 10 years old and served me well and this one picked up where it left off   Highly recommend it   Donâ€™t get lost in the complications of your computer use one that works and does the job but you donâ€™t have to obsess over it
review.name: Simple, clean, readable, powerful.

review.itemreviewed: ELEMNT ROAM V2 GPS Cycling Computer
review.reviewBody: I recently replaced my original ELEMNT with the ROAM V2. The one it replace was no longer had enough battery life for century rides. Other than that I wouldâ€™ve kept it. Now that I have the ROAM Iâ€™m so glad I upgraded. With a HR strap and power meter pedals I can do a century and still have 45% juice left. That in itself is impressive, on top of that the color screen is a great touch especially when it comes to climbing. With the descent of the climbs broken down to different colors from green for the easiest up to red for the hotter climbs itâ€™s nice to be able to take a quick look at the screen and see what the store down the road. I know thereâ€™s lots of functions that it has that I havenâ€™t used such as controlling a GoPro or Bluetooth lights. The music control is a nice touch too.  I canâ€™t say how it compares to other head units but I can say itâ€™s never left me feeling that it wanted more features or was displeased with it. Customizing the screens is relatively easy and the summit feature for climbs is nice
review.name: Does all you need

name: ELEMNT ROAM V2 GPS Cycling Computer

review.reviewBody: Have not had da chance to install yet.  I did partially extend the awning only to find metal shavings throughout.  So far no signs that it impacts/impacted the awning at this point.
review.name: Looks great

review.reviewBody: Fast deployment and retraction, simple to use
review.name: Awsome

review.reviewBody: Honestly, I do not know what I like better   the actual awning or how easy it is to install.  Thule nailed it!  I have this setup on my Tundra using Thule's 500XT racks.  It was a solo install and couldn't have been easier.  Once the adapters are placed as needed   it literally drops right into place.  No issues, super easy and fast.  The awning size is very generous and perfect for the ultimate car camping and/or overland experience.  I have it set up alongside my RTT and it's perfect.  Again, I strongly feel Thule nailed it with this awning.  Great job!
review.name: Fantastic Awning and Super Easy Install

review.reviewBody: I spent a ton of time evaluating the Hideaway against their primary competition   a close tie but I picked the Thule largely because of warranty and great customer service.  Because I was installing on a custom rack for my Sprinter Van I had to fabricate some mounts   which Thule could have in no way anticipated   which ended up working great (so well I made a YouTube video showing the install / operation).  High quality, solid construction   very happy.
review.name: Love this awning   instructions not so much

review.reviewBody: Buy the Tension Rafters (requires 2). This awning is now the BEST. Add these and angle the awning for rain to drain away (no water build up or sagging).
review.name: Tension Rafters

name: HideAway Awning Rack Mount

hasVariant.name: V3 Dropper Lever
hasVariant.description: Buy the OneUp Components V3 Dropper Lever online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
Quick Backstory...last year I was diagnosed with the onset of arthritis in my left thumb (bummer). I needed to modify how I did somethings, this included my dropper remote. On a long ride pushing it would become painful! Late last year I started doing some research on better, smother remote options. 

Fast-forward to recently...with the onset of the MTB season, I purchased a remote that boasted a "light action" manufactured by (who will not be named here). I tried to find a position on my handlebar that would allow the remote to actuate properly BUT I couldn't find a spot that didn't interfere with the break leaver. So back to the internet and more research. I found another remote manufactured by (who will not be named here) that had a redesigned "enlarged thumb pad." So I traded in the first one for this new one. I was able to find a perfect position to mount the remote BUT the tip of my thumb would catch on the the enlarged pad every time!?! So once again back to the internet and I spotted the OneUp Remote V3. Now last year when I first looked into a replacement remote I looked at the OneUp Remote V2. So I hadn't given a second thought to it until I realized it was an updated design. Reading through the description I spotted the "Lighter Action Design" boasting a â€27% less effort.â€ So I traded in the last remote for the OneUp and, just like in the tale of "Goldilocks and the Three Bears," THIS ONE WAS JUST RIGHT! I paired it with a Jagwire Pro Dropper Cable and Housing and I have to say sometimes I don't even know I'm pushing on the remote! In fact I'm having to retrain my mussel memory as I find myself pushing too hard and to fast. This set up requires a "light" touch. I would more than recommend this remote!
review.name: Tale of Three Remotes

name: V3 Dropper Lever

review.reviewBody:
Gave Backcountry a shot after not using them for years because they had a specific color of this shirt.  Come to find out once I ordered they still use DHL to ship as everyone knows DHL is the worst I thought maybe itâ€™s ok I have a week till my trip and it only says 3-5 days.  Well turns out to get from Virginia to the top of Tennessee one states width it takes 7 days to traverse I guess they have to use mountain goats I can normally get shipping from California faster with other carriers.
Bottom line donâ€™t use backcountry until they drop DHL.
review.name: Donâ€™t do business with Backcountry
comment: We are sorry to hear about the delay you experienced with your recent order and understand your frustration with DHL's shipping times. We appreciate your feedback regarding carrier preference and will pass it along to the appropriate team. You should have received an email with further details regarding this issue.

description: Buy the Michelin Wild Enduro 29in - Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Wild Enduro 29in - Tubeless Tire
hasVariant.description: Buy the Michelin Wild Enduro 29in - Tubeless Tire online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Tires were on sale for a good price so I figured I would try them out. I had a shop set them up for tubeless. Tires were going flat in between rides. I brought them back to the shop and they found that sealant was seeping through the sidewall on both tires. They did what the could to prevent me from having to buy new tires. I would have to add air before every ride as sealant continued to seep through sidewall just at a slower rate. After many flat tires well out riding I had enough and purchased new tires. I am now out the cost of the tires and the install fees.
review.name: Do not waste your money!

review.reviewBody: I owned this tire for 3 months and 200 miles before the bead tore in a 4 inch section. It was on flat ground on a smooth part of the trail and had not been damaged prior (only 200 miles or less of ride time).   Attempted to warranty directly with Michelin and was asked to take to a bike shop for an inspection. The first person who opened the case for me was fantastic, however my LBS has been trying to settle this for a week now and has not been able to reach someone that can finish the claim (02826286). Theyâ€™ve been dropped from calls more than once and have now resorted to email. They also told me that if this had been any of the other major tire manufacturers they sell, I would have had a replacement tire in the mail, no questions.   A real shame, as the tire was my favorite over the competitors prior to the warranty experience. Traction and rolling resistance was fantastic while it lasted.
review.name: Torn Bead/warranty a challenge

review.reviewBody: I have been riding these tires for just over two years now. Definitely more confidence inspiring than maxxis dhf and dhr ii. It grips better and is more durable than maxxis. It rolls slightly worse but you can carry extra speed in the corners. Casing is also more durable than the exo +. I kept puncturing the exo + casing but have not once punctured the michelin tires where it is not repairable, front or rear. I ride these tires in dry loose trails of socal.
review.name: Can't beat these

review.reviewBody: Bought this tire to replace the Maxxis Rekons on my Scott Spark 950. I have another bike with Schwalbe Magic Mary at front and Hans Dampf at rear and they were great on snow and ice. With more aggressive tire profile, I thought the Wild Enduro would have better grip. I was mistaken big time! This tire doesnâ€™t have any grip on cold, snowy and icy surface. I had to deflate the tire to around 15psi ( iâ€™m 5â€™11â€, 185lbs) in order for it to have at least some grip, and even with that pressure, I had to be really slow otherwise i would have slid all over the place. I had to walk my bike on descents as I would have definitely crashed going down. This tire might be good for tropical weather, but definitely not for the cold north.
review.name: Not for cold weather

review.reviewBody: Bought this tire to replace the Maxxis Rekons on my Scott Spark 950. I have another bike with Schwalbe Magic Mary at front and Hans Dampf at rear and they were great on snow and ice. With more aggressive tire profile, I thought the Wild Enduro would have better grip. I was mistaken big time! This tire doesnâ€™t have any grip on cold, snowy and icy surface. I had to deflate the tire to around 15psi ( iâ€™m 5â€™11â€, 185lbs) in order for it to have at least some grip, and even with that pressure, I had to be really slow otherwise i would have slid all over the place. I had to walk my bike on descents as I would have definitely crashed going down. This tire might be good for tropical weather, but definitely not for the cold north.
review.name: Not for cold weather

review.reviewBody: Covers moon dust to deep mud with competence and no problem areas where it doesn't work. While an Assegai w/Maxxgrip may beat it in the moon dust by a small amount, it weighs about 400g more. A dedicated mud-spike will also be better in the mud. But nothing beats the Wild Enduro as a tire that performs at the highest levels EVERYWHERE. IMO, this is the best tire ever made for the front end of a mt bike.   Rolling resistance is great for what it is, but not great if you compare it to an xc race tire, so it get 3 stars there, but it does roll faster than many other DH type tires so it gets one star back. Hard to judge this one...
review.name: Most Versatile Front Tire Ever

review.reviewBody: Have been running the Wild Enduro Front Magi-X and Wild Enduro Rear GUM-X3D for almost 4 months now and they have been some of the best cornering and root gripping tires that I have owned. Hands down better than the Maxxis Minion DHF and DHR combo that I had on previously. Would buy these again.
review.name: Excellent grip and low rolling resistance

review.reviewBody: Really good on most terrains unless its super GLOOPY muddy. Light enough to make it up all the climbs, strong enough for most descents. I have run these on the rear, but for rougher faster uplifted style terrain such as bike parks they are not quite strong enough and have torn them. I run these front and rear all year in the UK and just change them for alps holidays
review.name: Perfect for most uk riding

review.reviewBody: I have the front and rear combo and love them.  They literally leave trenches in the corners.  I have not had the durability issues mentioned above.  Best cornering combo I have ever riden.
review.name: My favorite tire

review.reviewBody: Great Tyre, Great Lasting , but i would say the Gum X compound would be a better choice for the wetter weather as the nobs are softer.
review.name: More of a summer Tyre

name: Wild Enduro 29in - Tubeless Tire

I purchased this robe particularly for a trip in very cold weather. The fabric is like a lightweight throw and is warm but not bulky. It looks new after washing and drying 3 times and shrank and shed very little. Even though the chat person said these robes are cut roomy I sized up. I'm 5'4" and 160 pounds and XL fits well enough. The torso is fine and the length is to my ankles; however, the robe is cut narrower toward the bottom and doesn't my lower legs very well. The sleeves fit over my nylon gowns but I struggle to get them on when damp from the bath.

hasVariant.description: Buy the Sierra Designs Meteor 2 Backpacking Tent: 2-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I just took this on an overnight solo backpacking trip and it was so spacious and nice but not too heavy! I am excited to use it for a duo trip soon. It was not supposed to snow but a storm rolled in and this kept me cozy in 18 degrees f and I noticed a huge difference inside the tent versus outside even with a ton of wind. Did not feel windy in the tent. This plus my Nemo Endless Promise Disco 15f bag kept me as warm as I could be with a much colder night than I had expected. Setup was a bit less intuitive than I thought but I didnâ€™t read the directions- just match up the red fly tag to the red base of the tent and it will all fall into place. I just overthought it but it was still a less than 10 minute setup in rain/snow. Rain fly is soooo waterproof and thick, same with base. I was going to try and get a 4 season tent but for backpacking, I think this is as much as you need and a good sleeping bag will take care of you. Fit well strapped to the outside of my pack, all of the packaging is well designed and well thought out. Colors are nice and neutral and my tent doesnâ€™t stand out too much in the woods as a solo lady, which I like. Would recommend to anyone as a great, inexpensive, roomy but light tent!
review.name: Excellent solo or duo backpacking tent!

review.reviewBody: I went on a week long camping trip and it rain all but 1 day. This little tent stayed dry during gusts and tornado like activity / warnings and watches.   It was a perfect 1 woman tent. I did yoga. Plenty of room to dress and undress. Did I say I stayed dry ALL week. Highly recommend this tent. Oh AND it's little! I didn't think there was a whole tent in the little bundle that arrived at my door.
review.name: Yep - waterproof! Just like it says

name: Meteor 2 Backpacking Tent: 2-Person 3-Season

The XS fit well except for the length which made a crease ay my upper thighs and made the stomach area pop out. Not flattering. I think the coat would work for a taller person.

comment: Hello, we appreciate you leaving the review. We're committed to making sure to turn your experience around to a rather delightful one. If you require our assistance, please contact us using our Contact Us form on the following website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat so we can help you further. Weâ€™re available Mon.-Fri. 9AM - 5PM EST. Thank you!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The womenâ€™s echo featherless jacket, is more like a coat in that the length covers all the places I get cold. My neighbor was wearing one and I asked her for the details and I am so glad I ordered one for myself! It is warm, the shape is flattering, not puffy and the hood is extra cozy. Itâ€™s two way zipper shows that the designers gave attention to details. I usually only want down jackets but this one has won me over. I am only sad that itâ€™s getting too warm to wear it now that spring has finally come but I know it will be my go to when it gets cold again!
review.name: I love this light weight jacket/coat

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This coat is great for those transitional times of the year. Itâ€™s warm and covers your rear for extra warmth.

The lightness of this coat is â€¦ equivalent to a feather, yet, toasty warm. I wanted the black coat but the sale price on this coat was too good to be true.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love this jacket for a lightweight layer (a Minnesotan considers this a good jacket for 32-50 F). Runs slightly large. I am a true medium and thereâ€™s plenty of room for layering in a Medium. Fabric is not super shiny like some reviews mention.

review.reviewBody: great jacket - wife loves it . Fits great and is quality

hasVariant.name: Albert Beanie
hasVariant.description: Buy the DAKINE Albert Beanie online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
BALD GUY FAVORITE! Iâ€™ve shopped around for the perfect POW hat for those double blacks, when Iâ€™m hanging off the side of the hill, struggling, powder in the face, goggles iced over, fresh clouds blowing across the brow, icing over.  
Being raised on the east coast, where the winters are cold but dry, and starting a new life here in the eastern sierras, I can personally vouch that this beanie, Albert, is his name, gave me a second chance at the warmth of a full head of hair again. All of the liftees and patrolman with their full heads of hair and straggly beards, iced over with their â€œTGRâ€ beanies and buffs named after a sacred place in Jackson Hole, heading in early off the cold double blacks of the highest ski-able peak of the eastern sierras, while Iâ€™m there. Hanging off the side of the aforementioned hill, hanging out, stuck, no business on this hill, until the groomers show up to the rescue. This hat individually made the difference. Not my $349 Helly Jacket or La Puet socks. No. This thick, Dakine, beanie made the difference. It gave me a second chance at redemption while I mounted my skis under my buttocks, and skid down that double black, like a toddler on his first day in a snow tube. Head warm, head dry, and a sparkle in my eye. For $30, nothing holds a flame, nor iceberg to this beanie. 10/10. Iâ€™d buy the entire stock, but I need a new $700 FlyLow get up. Maybe next time, but certainly wonâ€™t be the last. This hat goes everywhere, in the summers of San Diego, or the winters of Mammoth Lakes, I will not leave this behind. 
THIS IS KNIT HOW BEANIES SHOULD BE. DONT BUY IF YOU LIKE BEING COLD AND WET! 
Buy it for the nostalgia of the warmth of your mothers first kiss on your forehead, or the cuddles from a warm grizzly in a winters cave just before hibernation.
review.name: Warmest hat for the hill

name: Albert Beanie

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Low WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought because I had Winter Sorel boots and I still love them - they still are perfect after 4 yrs wear. However, , the Out N About shoes are not even close to comfort, not to mention- the quality. The above shoes are Ok for walking,maybe not too far as they are hard on foot. They were waterproof- I did non find an issue until the sole started coming off. The quality is definitely not the best. After 1yr of having them ( and I only wear them oct-nov and febr-april time as they are too warm for summer, too cold for winter) . I will not be buying them again.
review.name: Poor quality

review.itemreviewed: Out N About III Low WP Sneaker - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I bought these shoes in April 2024 for traveling â€” stylish and lightweight for long urban walks and everyday exploring. But after 6 months of use (even with after market insoles), I can firmly say that those traits do not equal comfort. The rocker sole in the forefoot area leads to discomfort in the balls of my feet after ~15-20 minutes of walking, but when it's my only pair of "walking" shoes on a trip, I'm stuck with 'em all day...which has led to developing chronic nerve pain/Morton's neuroma for the past 3 months. The laces also have an odd pressure point on the tops of my feet, so I have to keep them loosely laced, leading to further strain and foot fatigue overall. I've taken a few trips with these shoes this year, and by the end of them, I am limping my way home through the airport. I've never felt more discouraged in my body thanks to these shoes. :-/
Lastly, the glue is starting to come undone on the rubber outsole at the toe. I've been a big Sorel shoe fan for 10 years and raved about their comfort and design, but these considerably miss the mark.
Pros: Wide toe box, fun tread design
For reference, I have: 9.5 shoe size, on the narrower side of normal width, flat arch, use Superfeet insoles
review.name: Misses the mark on comfort
comment: Oh no! We'd love to hear more about your thoughts on our shoes. Please contact our Customer Care team so we can get to the bottom of what wasn't so great about your experience.

review.reviewBody:
Purchased this more of a look rather than a noise reducer. Upon installation, found that it actually made more wind noise than the Thule rack itself. 

The strap system is pretty upsetting. There really is no â€œtightening itâ€. Itâ€™s just a plastic looped ratchet system that youâ€™d find on a bicycle rack to keep the tire in the tray. It doesnâ€™t apply any downward force to keep it planted on top of the roof. Once vehicles starts, it rattles and when getting head wind, it rattles as well. It felt like a joke. I have since placed foam pads underneath the feet to keep the noise down. 

Along with this, it doesnâ€™t sit flush due to the system having no downward force to keep it planted to the roof of your vehicle. Cost on these I canâ€™t imagine is enough for Thule to worry about reviews but this one definitely needs a redesign.
review.name: Disappointing
comment: Thank you for alerting us to the issues you experienced with your Thule AirScreen XT. A representative has reached out for more information and help troubleshoot the installation.

review.reviewBody: iâ€™ve had this wind fairing for maybe 18 months. the straps that hold it to the rack broke so i went to reorder in the spare parts sections. 4 replacement brackets cost as much as the whole product! needless to say, not ordering it replacibg this fancy plastic panel.
review.name: doesnâ€™t last long

review.reviewBody: Nice, just one thing, when you are betwen a truck, the airscreen shake on the top little bite.
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: I bought this for use with my rooftop tent as it is very noisy. I followed the mediocre fitment guide. It does fit....kinda. Install is easy but it can't be tightened so it constantly knocks on the sunroof of my car which is almost more annoying than the wind noise. I installed it on a 2019 CX-5 with fixed point roof bars and this sits on the sunroof, this has pros and cons. The pro is that it doesn't sit on the paint at all and I didn't have to put the stupid paint saving stickers on my car the Con's would be that it sits on my sunroof so I can't use the sunroof which sucks since I made sure to get the bars that wouldn't interfere with the sunroof operation. I wouldn't buy this again unfortunately and I feel I over paid by way more than this cheap piece of plastic is worth definitely paid for the name not the product.
review.name: Wanted to love this
comment:
Thank you for contacting Thule. I am sorry to hear about the fit issues you experienced with your Thule AirScreen XT. 
A member of our customer support team reached out for more information on the problem to see if we can recommend a solution.

review.reviewBody: First, I'm a big fan of Thule. Great service/after service and really enjoy every piece that I bought here. BUT for the first time, I will not recommend this one. I put the size large on my new Kia Telluride for reduce the sound of my evo wingbar. This part is working.. it is reducing the noise from the wingbar but the AirScreen XT L don't stay in place. It is clapping on my roof even if I do everything that Thule recommended. Loose the strap, Tight the strap, move the wingbar.. It still flapping on the right side one day and left side on the other day. Just not working properly. Need improvement and I'm sure that Thule will do.
review.name: Not as expected...
comment:
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule AirScreen XT. I understand your frustration with the insecure fit to your vehicle. 
Based on Thule's fit information, the Large size fairing is not the appropriate size for the Kia Telluride. Thule's fit specifications recommends the Medium size for the best fit. I am sorry this information was not provided at the time of purchase.

review.reviewBody: It eliminated all of the howling between my cross bars and around 70% of the wind noise. While it took a little bit of effort to tighten all the straps, the entire assembly was well designed and solid. Iâ€™ve driven it at highway speeds and the setup remains tight and in place. Compared to its competitors, I found it to be more durable (due to the plastic reinforcements on the side) while remaining lightweight.
review.name: Great fit for a 22â€™ Mitsubishi Outlander

review.reviewBody: I bought this to eliminate some noise coming from the eco bar roof rack recently installed. It worked perfectly! Easy to instal and did exactly what it was supposed to do. Much quieter ride with the sunroof open now. Thanks Thule.
review.name: Worked perfectly!

review.reviewBody: I just bought air screen and it 100% helps with the wind noise but at highway speeds Iâ€™m hearing a rattling sound like itâ€™s smacking against the roof?
review.name: Great product but
comment:
Thank you for getting in touch! I'm glad to hear you're enjoying your Thule AirScreen XT.
If you are hearing some rattling, I recommend checking the tension of the straps holding the fairing to your crossbars. Also, if the AirScreen XT is not the size rated as a fit for your vehicle, that could also lead to some rattling. 
If these suggestions do not help, please reach out to Thule Customer Service at 800-238-2388, Monday through Friday 8:30-5:30 EST, for live troubleshooting assistance.

review.reviewBody: Looks like it will only increase frontal area and create a huge drag behind the screen making aerodynamic performance worse than just roof racks.
review.name: Would love to see the aero testing on this..
comment:
Thank you for your question!
The Thule AirScreen XT is designed to prevent air from moving around the crossbar, which is the main cause of wind noise. Instead, the air is directed over and around the crossbar, which improves the flow. 
When sized properly to the vehicle, the AirScreen forms a sloping front face, rather than a flat, vertical plane.

review.reviewBody: No matter what way I camp on the fairing, it continues to flap and hit the top of my car!
review.name: Clamps suck
comment:
Hi Trey,

Thank you for alerting us to the problem! I'm sorry to hear that your Thule AirScreen XT isn't fitting securely to your vehicle. Common causes for this issue are using the fairing a set of non-Thule crossbars, or is a different size than what is recommended for the vehicle. 

I reached out via email to walk through some other troubleshooting steps, and I'm sure we can find a solution!

name: Airscreen XT Wind Fairing

review.reviewBody: Love these for gravel, but expect to lose bottles if using for MTB.
review.name: Solid, but not for rough terrain

review.reviewBody: This bottle cage works excellent on the Ibis Ripmo. That bike model has issues with some bottle cages because with other cages, the bottle sits too deep, rubs against the frame, and causes damage due to the bike's geometry and bottle cage mounting location. This does an excellent job at protecting the bike from inadvertent frame damage and providing quick and easy access to a water bottle... I almost forgot to mention that it's light as a feather. I got the oil slick color option and it looks great on my bike.
review.name: Perfect for my Ibis Ripmo

review.reviewBody: I have three pairs of Ruckus shorts and they fit all the same. The ones I just got are way too small. They are labeled a 32 like my others but more like a 30 waits or less. That is poor QC.
review.name: Way too small

review.reviewBody: Bought this for my husband and it was way too small and they don't have the next size up. Very weird since everyone is saying it's true to size-maybe it's a blemo!
review.name: Way too Small

review.reviewBody: This is the swiss army knife, light enough for a 120mm bike down country pedal, enough pockets if you needed to do a long ride in the high country, I mean, they do it all. Ventilation, storage, durable light fabric. These are a bit longer than my other shorts, but not bad at all. Really awesome shorts to have in the arsenal.
review.name: If tld made pocket knives

review.reviewBody: A little pricey but by far the best fit and amazing functionality! I don't ride a dropper seat and never caught my crotch with these.  I can ride these days long. They are by far my new favorites.  Customer service at the company is amazing as well. Strong Recommend. Stop looking, these are the ones!
review.name: Best fit of so many brands!

review.reviewBody:
Shorts are fine, liners could be more durable. 
The stitching on the chamois came loose after fewer than 5 rides. Within a few more rides the waistband stitching failed, allowing the body of the liners to tear free of the waistband.
review.name: Nice shorts, liner durability is lacking

review.reviewBody: Comfortable liner, nice waist adjustments, mesh pockets are nice too. Used for one week now, riding in them 10-12miles a day and washing them every day. They seem to be holding up fine. I haven?t ?bailed? in them yet so I can?t say for durable in that sense but otherwise great so far. The fit was right on too.  I definitely quality as a larger rider 6?2? and about a 240 pounder. The 38 was a perfect fit. Would recommend for sure!
review.name: Works great!

review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair of ruckus shorts and chamois back in 2017 and that original pair has less problems than the two pairs I bought 6 months ago. I ride every day so the shorts and chamois get a lot of use but my old pair never had any issues. The two newest pairs I bought have completely fallen apart. The stitching has come undone all over the shorts, and the chamois stitching has come undone halfway. The quality of TLD products has gone from a 10/10 to 2/10. Super disappointing...hope they fix their issues but in the meantime steer clear. Absolute trash quality so unless they drop the price to $40 for the shorts and chamois, steer clear. So sad and disappointing.
review.name: TLD Get Your Act Together

review.reviewBody: Solid shorts; tough and don't bind you.  Its too hot here for the chamois but I have a tough undercarriage.  Perfectly comfy without.
review.name: so sick..

review.reviewBody: Feels heavy and hard to keep in place, unlike the Skyline Air, that feels light and custom fitted. The feel of the fabric is not the same as the Skyline's either.
review.name: Ruckus Short

name: Ruckus Short + Liner - Men's

review.reviewBody:
These Shoes feel and look amazing...
I like them so much, that I will purchase another pair
To have on standby!!!
review.name: AWESOME SHOES!!!

review.reviewBody: The new torch 3.0 feels stiffer and has a bit more volume in the front of the shoe. Very comfortable and look good. Still getting used to the change from the old torch of which I had a few pairs.
review.name: Stiffer and a bit more volume

review.reviewBody:
The area directly over the top BOA dial is unpadded. The tongue of the shoe does not extend past this point, causing a pressure point which digs into your tibiofibular joint. The offset design causes the tongue to naturally slide outward, causing the stiff outer upper of the shoe to dig into your skin instead of even pressure being applied across the top of the foot. 

Besides this, the shoe feels perfect. Seriously considering a return.
review.name: Almost perfect

name: Torch 3.0 Cycling Shoe

review.reviewBody: These shoes fit well and felt great. Through the cobblestone streets of Prague to the wet stone paths of the Bohemian Switzerland National Forest, my feet were kept comfortable and without slipping. High recommended for casual hiking adventures.
review.name: Great Casual Hikers

review.reviewBody: Amazing product & water proof. Break in period of about a day and a half , &  after they are super comfortable. Put them on & use them a bit & the shoe will fit to your foot . I have wide feet & not a very big arch, Iâ€™m flat footed. Shoes with a big arch bother me, but I got used to this one after a few days. Would highly recommend, got them for my OBX camp out surf trip.
review.name: Break them in first ,& youâ€™ll love them

review.reviewBody: The tongue stiching broke within three days, just wearing them around the house   Lousy workmanship and lousy shoes
review.name: Lousy workmanship
comment: We'd love the opportunity to help at 800-288-3124 or live chat at Merrell.com.

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable to west out of the box and has good grips for hiking.
review.name: Merrill solo hiking shoes, very comfortable.

review.reviewBody: Shoes are light weight and comfortable from the first time they were worn.  Used for light hiking in Arches and Canyonlands National Parks.  Highly recommend.
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: Tried these on in-store and they were super comfortable. IRL, maybe a little less comfortable after wearing for long stretches of wear. I think that's because my foot is sliding up in the shoe - I opted to go 1/2 size up as I was right in between sizes. Maybe that was a mistake? Very easy to clean after trail or barn work and they work well with a variety of styles, jeans to tech pants.
review.name: Comfortable but not as comfortable as I hoped

review.reviewBody:
Usually I destroy a shoe like this by opening holes in the sides, having the sole peel off, or some other fundamental part falls apart.  Here, everything just wore down, mostly evenly, over a lot of miles.

The deconstructed design is a bit weird - oh well, it performs.  Many, many miles later, the heel is starting to come apart, just as the tread is wearing smooth, just as the laces are frayed.  

It's a good shoe.  Hopefully the next will be as good.
review.name: It's a good sign when the sole wears out.
comment: Thank you for sharing your thoughts with us!

review.reviewBody:
I wanted to like these for many reasons, and I was replacing a broken down pair that had re-triggered my plantar fasciitis.  I actually have two pair of these, one with my orthotic inserts and one without.  While I thought the fit and cushioning were good, Iâ€™m a month in to these and my foot is worse not better.

One of those weeks was at Yellowstone/ Grand Teton.  I used the real Moabâ€™s on the trails without much of an issue.  But even on perfect footing of the boardwalks I started observing how much inward role I was getting with these, even with a new pair of orthotics.  Anyway they are cool looking shoes but my PT recommended the trash can for them.  Iâ€™m doing much better with my Trail Gloves as those, of course, and much closer to a zero drop and I donâ€™t pronate if I forefoot-strike.
review.name: Not for Pronators.

review.reviewBody: Shoes were very comfortable.  Seems very good for all day.
review.name: Recently purchased shoes

review.reviewBody: These shoes fit true to size and comfortable right out of the box. They are great for day to day or hiking. They seem to be well put together, no issues a month in. Definitely recommend and you can't beat the price.
review.name: Fantastic Shoe for the Money

review.reviewBody: I love this jacket! I live in Minnesota and it's in the 20's Fahrenheit this week. I can drive around in the car with this jacket and not get hot, but walk the dog outside for 30 minutes and feel so comfortable! I can run errands down to around 0 degrees in and out of the car to the store. Long dog walks would require a shell under 15 degrees.
review.name: My new favorite jacket

review.reviewBody: Almost perfect jacket. My only complaint would either be touch longer sleeve or the cuff to extend around the thumb.
review.name: Yes, I would buy again.

review.reviewBody: The TNF Terra Peak jacket is great for staying warm. The material feels nice and sturdy, so I feel like it'll hold up well. That said, there are a couple of things that I don't like. It doesn't have a cord at the bottom to tighten it up, so wind can sneak in sometimes. Also, without the cord, it makes the jacket look pretty boxy, which can make you look kind of bulky and square.
review.name: Great jack with an drawback

review.reviewBody: The TNF Terra Peak jacket is honestly one of the coziest jackets I own, and it's great for staying warm. The material feels nice and sturdy, so I feel like it'll hold up well. That said, there are a couple of things that I don't like. It doesn't have a cord at the bottom to tighten it up, so wind can sneak in sometimes. Also, without the cord, it makes the jacket look pretty boxy, which can make you look kind of bulky and square. Still, for comfort and warmth, it's awesome-just not the most flattering shape.
review.name: Great jack with an drawback

review.reviewBody: I've been waiting for a replacement for my original North Face winter jacket. All the options available before this were slim fit only, until this garment became available. It's comfortable, warm, and fits great. Looking forward to wearing it for many winter seasons to come.
review.name: Excellent Purchase and Great Fitting.

review.reviewBody: Love the selection of colors on this jacket. I purchased beetroot.
review.name: I would buy this jacket again!

review.reviewBody: I haven't had a chance to use this in the winter, so take this review with a grain of salt, but I noticed that nobody had reviewed yet so I figured I'd weigh in with some initial impressions in case other people were on the fence like I was. I think the risk you run buying TNF gear online is that you might accidentally wind up with something geared more towards the instagram crowd instead of something that will actually work in the outdoors. Fortunately this piece seems to be the latter. It's thicker than it appears in the images, and seems well-built. Definitely more of a mid-weight than a mini-puff, and the underarm things do seem to help with movement. It does kind of puff up around the belly area, but I feel like most jackets of this weight will do that. It's light-ish, and it does fit into the chest pocket as advertised. As stated earlier it is a bit thicker than it appears in the images, and when I tried it on under my not-very-baggy jacket that I've been using as a shell the whole thing looked and felt kind of tight. That said, if you have a roomier shell I think this would be a pretty sweet mid-layer if it's legitimately cold out. I'll update this winter if I remember.
review.name: Initial impressions

review.reviewBody: the quality of the construction and design are exceptional. Looking forward to putting this pack to use.
review.name: Great pack!

review.reviewBody:
The good: robust fabrics; the zipper system (love it), the adjustable harness

The soso: ventilated backs make a lot of difference in hot climates, and the Coulee is NOT a cool pack (no MR pack is);  if the center zipper  ran another 3 inches closer to the bottom of the main compartment I may have been willing to look more kindly on the fatal flaw (below)

The bad and the ugly: why does a 40L pack frame need to be 24 inches tall? So it makes your life miserable when you fly with it? MR could have easily shaved 2 inches off the height and increased the width by an inch to hit the volume target and kept it 100% carry-on compliant. At 24" tall you roll the dice every time you board. I would have used it to carry photo gear but can't take the risk of being asked to check it 

I wanted to love it but can't.
review.name: Good pack with a fatal flaw

review.reviewBody: Quality backpacks, highly recommend these backpacks to anybody looking for  a quality pack that is built to last.
review.name: Great Backpacks

review.reviewBody: Love the new backpack!  Super light. Nice waist padding.
review.name: Great pack

review.reviewBody: Great product all around; a friend and I each bought one, and I purchased a different style for my son for hiking & scouting... I will never buy anything but Mystery Ranch; the quality is different!
review.name: Perfect all the way around.....

review.reviewBody: Love this pack. Great suspension system. Easily centers pack weight and is exceptionally comfortable. Great Job Mystery Ranch.
review.name: Great Design

review.reviewBody: Really comfortable daypack with great storage options.
review.name: Great pack!

review.reviewBody: I bought an XL size coulee 40 & am very pleased with the purchase. I may even have to buy the M sized hip belt because of my weight loss. Super comfortable & adjustable & plenty of room for an overnight hiking trip! Highly recommend!
review.name: Super comfortable!

review.reviewBody: This is a big enough pack for a lightweight solo hiker. I can scramble with several liters of water and all my supplies and food very comfortably. The belt and harness are the most comfortable Iâ€™ve used with up to fifty pounds of weight. I canâ€™t imagine using this for more, however. If longer duration or more gear is needed, there is the Coulee 50. Built like a tank, big zippers, durable materials. Highly recommended.
review.name: Great two day pack

review.reviewBody:
The pack was great but it needed a few things. 

CONS: 1. First off, the sleeping bag compartment did not have stretch-material straps so if you have a sleeping bag thatâ€™s larger than a â€œbackpackingâ€ sleeping bag, it will not fit and you will be forced to put it inside the main compartment. The straps on the bottom also barely fit my 2 person tent. Had to extend them all the way and it was a stretch. 
2. The backpack itself did not hold as much as my Gregory 38 liter did, and the MR boasted that it was a 40 liter. So be cognizant of that. You wonâ€™t be able to take much more than the essentials. 

PROS: 1. The material is top notch. I would be confident that if I dropped and dragged this pack on blacktop for a mile, it would hold up just fine. 2. I also enjoyed the tri-zip compartment that lets you access the main body of the pack. Great idea. 

Overall, the pack is great for days trips or LIGHT overnights. Just didnâ€™t fit my particular needs.
review.name: Great pack, not roomy

review.reviewBody: I really like my Proxima 30 not just because I bought it at a nice price but also I've been using it every day for work, biking, hiking, international traveling and working out. It's actually my first Osprey bag and I fell in love with the brand now.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Really spacious pack with an awesome amount of different pockets and well thought out design features. The only downsides are that at 30l, a second chest/waist strap would be nice and that it is impossible to fully unzip the main compartment when the side straps are buckled.
review.name: Really spacious pack with an

review.reviewBody:
TL;DR: Love this bag, would recommend to anyone looking for a clean-looking bag for weekend trips / office.

Requirements:

Can hold all my stuff for a weekend trip, short hikes, and going to the office. 30L felt like the right size because I often pack more than just the basic essentials

Needed an elevated laptop pocket because I was using this to carry my macbook to the office

A reliable warranty policy in case it shows unexpected wear after a year

Use: Mostly what I mentioned in requirements, plus some trips down to the beach.

Pros:

I love the simple look of the Proxima. No long dangling compression straps, and if you close up the front it looks really nice.

Lots of pockets inside to hold my wallet / keys / money / pens / medicine. There's also a couple flat pockets in the main component where I sometimes put my kindle

Very comfortable on my shoulders

My big water bottle easily fits in the stretch pockets on the side

Overall really good build quality: the zippers are heavy-duty, no shifting of the padding in the shoulder straps

Cons:

My shoulders and back definitely get sweaty after carrying this around for a while on hikes
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Perfect bag for my school needs. Stylish, comfortable, and sustainable. Would recommend!
review.name: Perfect bag for my school

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The side pockets are great for large water bottles. The laptop pocket is very functional- itâ€™s a perfect fit and the cushion is much needed. Itâ€™s a little smaller than i imagined. I wish there was a clip somewhere to clip a lunchbox. The the zipper half way is hard to get large binders in quickly. Itâ€™s a little too pricy for what it is in my opinion.
review.name: The side pockets are great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The purple color was a bit darker than seen on webpage, with a hue of maroon. Would like it more if more purple. Love the various compartments! Which is a necessity for a 30L bag, great for weekend travels.
review.name: The purple color was a

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very nice backpack for commuting and traveling. Plenty of pockets for laptop and gadgets.
review.name: Very nice backpack for commuting

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Sturdy with plenty of packing space for a weekend trip. Cumbersome zippers that do not open all the way down. However, it can help deter stuff getting stolen by pickpockets. Beautiful color mixtures and different intricacies like the double drink holders (can carry a 32 Oz) or umbrella when traveling. Hope it will last long.
review.name: Sturdy with plenty of packing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased this backpack for college and it is great for my needs. It fits my laptop, notebooks, and other supplies well and has plenty of pockets for everything I need. It is also quite comfortable to carry around and has good padding for my back and on the straps.
review.name: I purchased this backpack for

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great work backpack for all the essentials plus some! Great combo of outdoor and traditional backpack.
review.name: Great work backpack for all

review.reviewBody: I never received my order. There is an error in there software shipping methods. It took a long time to be corrected and I never got anything.
review.name: Never received my order

review.reviewBody:
I recently snagged the Patagonia Micro D Fleece Jacket for my hiking adventures, and it's quickly become a go-to piece. Here's why I love it:

 * Softness Supreme: This fleece is unbelievably soft and cozy. It feels luxurious against the skin, making it a true comfort layer, especially during those chilly mornings around the campfire.

 * Layering Champion: Whether I'm layering it under a shell for a windy hike or wearing it on its own for a crisp fall walk, the Micro D delivers the perfect warmth. It's packable and lightweight, making it a convenient layer to have on hand.
 * Surprisingly Dry: I was impressed by how well the fleece wicks away moisture. Even during light hikes, I stayed comfortable and dry.

A minor heads-up: Some reviewers mentioned the sleeves feeling a tad snug, especially when layering. I found this to be true, so if you prefer a looser fit, you might want to size up.

Overall, the Patagonia Micro D Fleece Jacket is a winner. It's become a trusted companion for my outdoor adventures, offering comfort, warmth, and versatility.
review.name: A Perfect Companion for Chilly Adventure

review.reviewBody: I bought the XL and it fits very well. Not baggy. Not tight. I wore it during an international flight and it kept me warm. But, not sweaty. Great quality. Looks sharp in black. Money well spent.
review.name: Warm and Light

review.reviewBody: This is a very good jacket.  Ultra soft  with sleeves that are plenty long.   Very warm for a lightweight jacket.  My only complaint is that the hand pockets don't have zippers.  The description says they do have zippers.
review.name: Great, lightweight jacket

review.reviewBody: I?ve had this jacket awhile now and it?s my favorite. It?s super lightweight and soft. Perfect for San Diego!  Looks great too. I got a men?s XS and I?m kind of a petite female and it fits perfect. Also I?ve washed it a bunch and the fleece still looks like new. Wish they had more colors in this jacket.
review.name: Most comfortable lightweight jacket

name: Micro D Fleece Jacket - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Hyper Hiker Low Hiking Shoe - Kids'
review.reviewBody:
Take care with the sizing. Smaller than other Adidas models. 
We bought online for 4yr old daughter. She was happy with the fit and colour. We thought they looked smart but there was no room for growth. We ordered them in the same size (10k) as the Adidas Grand Court 2.0 trainers we bought recently which still have some room. We were therefore surprised to find these Terrex shoes are a good half a size smaller. 
We were pleased with the shoe otherwise so we have ordered a larger size (10.5k) in a similar model (since no availability in the same model).
Star off off for the hassle of returning, and because we don't yet know how they will perform.
review.name: Returned - slightly too small.

review.reviewBody: Nice socks but run quite small. Size L is supposed to be 9-11.5 US, I'm a 10.5 US and I could barely squeeze into them. The mesh on top also doesn't seem as breathable as the Darn Tough version of this sock, definitely prefer those.

review.itemreviewed: Run Targeted Cushion Low Ankle Sock
Run Targeted Cushion Low Ankle Sock
review.reviewBody: These are my go-to socks for comfortable feet all day. I'm not running anymore, but I wish I'd had these when I did! These have the perfect balance of cushioning and weight, and the stretch keeps them snug and comfortable, too. I like them enough I'm buying more.
review.name: Cushy, comfie feet

hasVariant.name: S/Pro Alpha 120 Ski Boot - 2024 - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Salomon S/Pro Alpha 120 Ski Boot - 2024 - Men's online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Wow, these literally feel like a second skin.  It hugs every part of my foot and leg with equal pressure and I forget I am even wearing them.  I an 115 pounds and when I rented...I was unusually a  90 flex. I stepped up to 120 here and was a bit nervous.  Instead I found it was so much easier to walk in these boots fully locked in.  And actual skiing I felt was so much more responsive.  One mistake I made was a left them in my truck overnight and they were cold and I could not get into them that one day.  So...lesson....make sure the boots are room temperature when you first put them on. I am normally a size 7 mens....got the 24.5
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: Iâ€™ve been wearing Solomon boots for about 38 years. Iâ€™ve only had a chance to wear these once because I bought them late in the season. The biggest compliment I can give them is that I forgot they were there. Extremely comfortable. They also give me enough control to get my skis to do whatever I ask them to do. They are the stiffest boots Iâ€™ve owned and again, I didnâ€™t notice them.
review.name: Great Boots

review.reviewBody: I have a narrow foot and narrow heal. Used to always ski in race boots. This is the second version of this boot I have skied and it is incredible heal hold. And the grip walk sole is fantastic.
review.name: Incredible fit and heal hold

review.reviewBody: The S/Pro Alpha 120â€™s fit is incredibly dialed for low-volume feet, with an ultra-snug cuff that wraps the lower leg with room for shin bang. But the new shape raises the top of the scaffo above the instep and will be much more generous for a lot of skiers. The tongue of the boot starts stiff and ramps up very quickly, delivering precise turn-initiation and snappy feedback on snow, the lateral stiffness felt incredible carving high-speed turns and snaking through bump lines. I was impressed by Salomonâ€™s attention to customer feedback, improving the fit and features of their low-volume offering in new and surprising ways.
review.name: Big improvement over the (already good) S/Max

name: S/Pro Alpha 120 Ski Boot - 2024 - Men's

description: Buy the Black Diamond Crack Climbing Glove online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Crack Climbing Glove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Crack Climbing Glove online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: These gloves are the best I've tried. Thin but mighty! Still not quite a good as a good tape job but that is to be expected.
review.name: Jamming

review.reviewBody: I am a medium in all BD gloves, but the these definitely needed to be a large. Could get them on, but not get the wrist closure done up. Ended up giving them to a friend who loves them. Much thinner than Ocun, but surprisingly good protection.
review.name: Feel great, durability is okay, runs small

review.reviewBody:
Love these. Ocuns are basically shoes for your feet, which are dope but I personally like something thin, protective and be able to feel the rock. This is a step up from tape. They feel great, thin, but protective and incredibly durable. After while, I forgot Iâ€™m even wearing them. So cozy. 

White is certainly an interesting choice given how dirty and grimey from sweat they get, but theyâ€™re chill. 

The sizing guide on the site is not helpful, sadly. I like the crag gloves from BD, these not only run small but the fit is so different. I have great palm and knuckle coverage based off the measurements, but my fingers are a little tight and i can just barely velcro on my wrist. I got a Small, and the crag gloves in a Small are fit perfect. These are way too tight. I asked my friends what size they had (and we all have about the same size hand and iâ€™ve worn their gloves before) and theyre wearing Larges! So, definitely try these on in store and find a good fit, because the size guide for buying blind isnâ€™t entirely accurate for how you want they to actually feel. 

other than than, bomber. love them
review.name: Great gloves for doing crack

review.reviewBody: Ran a little tight on my fingers so had to size up but the RMA was easy!
review.name: Great crack gloves

review.reviewBody: This is soooo much better than taping and while they seem to run a bit small (I typically wear a medium glove in everything and these in medium are very snug), they have held up extremely well. I'm well over 50 pitches of use and they are dirty but not torn.
review.name: Crack gloves work

review.reviewBody: The size is a bit smaller than I expected so the gloves are a bit tight. But I guess tight is better than loose so the glove does not slide around on my hand. Provides solid protection and secure hand jams and locks.
review.name: Tight but solid protection

review.reviewBody: The crack gloves are an outstanding tool to have in your crag kit. Easy to put on and take off, they add the right amount of protection where you need it for tackling cracks.
review.name: Crack-a-licious gloves

review.reviewBody: These are super thin and seem durable. Every other glove Iâ€™ve tried are either too thick like the ocun gloves or not durable like the OR gloves. These are pretty bomber and are nice and thin. They run small though.
review.name: Really good

review.reviewBody: I measured my hand like the site said, but the gloves came in to tight for my hand , would recommend the next size if your measurements are in between a size , I sold them to a friend that fitted her perfectly. For sure next time Iâ€™ll order them a little bigger. The product looked nice.
review.name: Didnâ€™t fit

review.reviewBody: The velcro around the wrist is an issue. It has to be longer and ideally covered with the same textile as for the gloves. I need to glue/stitch something on my gloves cause I can't use them the way they are.
review.name: Great fit, but velcro the velcro has to be modified

name: Crack Climbing Glove

description: Buy the So iLL Clippers online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Clippers
hasVariant.description: Buy the So iLL Clippers online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought these So Ill clippers for my teenage son, an avid indoor climber.  His fingernails mustn't interfere with his grip on the boulders.  He just informed me that the tips of the finger- and toenail clippers block the view of his nails.  They're designed too large and every compression is a hesitant guess that the right amount of the cuticle gets severed. He prefers traditional clippers found in the beauty aisle.  Old-style clippers had more time to evolve to their present form, but I applaud So Ill with two stars for the imagination and bravado to push a stately design forward.  Perhaps they'll take a stab at the dish sponge. 

Backcountry, what do you advise I do with these useless clippers?
review.name: Looks Cool but Impractical

name: Clippers

review.itemreviewed: Rover BUGrip GTX Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes a few weeks ago! I hike,run 30 miles a week! I hike on snow pack snow , run on ice , I even went out with over a foot of snow ! Love these shoes the only hard part of my run hike is walking on the pavement lol

review.reviewBody: I have many skis and this is one of my favorite.  Super playful and easy to ski.  Can do every aspect of the mountain and rocks in the pow.
review.name: Can't lose with this ski

review.reviewBody: I have been skiing on the M-Free 108 since it first came out 5 or so years ago.  I am 5'9" and 170lbs.  I have skied both the 182cm and the 192cm.  I ski Vail and am a Freeride ski coach.  The 182cm is my choice for most days.  The characteristics of being a strong and stable ski while also being playful and pivotable is what I love about this ski.  The 192cm excels on bigger more open terrain.  This year I will elect to get the 185cm, which I am really excited about.  This ski is truly a classic that can do it all and instills major confidence on the mountain.
review.name: Favorite ski of all time!

name: M-Free 108 Ski - 2025

description: Buy the Black Diamond Venom Light Classic Ice Axe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Venom Light Classic Ice Axe
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Venom Light Classic Ice Axe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: As it is, this piolet makes perfect sense. Add on the modular enhancements and now you have the most versatile tool for your winter adventures. My only original concern was the sturdiness of the modular system, I can now say, this tool is solid!
review.name: Versatility is key

review.reviewBody: Wanted a second ice axe but didn't want the weight. Took this on a Goode Mt trip, did the Goode Stormking Col descent and this light weight axe performed! Can't wait for further adventures with the Venom!
review.name: Venom LT piolet

review.reviewBody: super light, sturdy, with options to connect other tools to improve functionality for your specific goal. great piolet.
review.name: exceliot

review.reviewBody:
I've had a few ultra light axes that are great for lightweight use, but this axe feels a bit more like a normal "real" axe in terms of pick length and adze size (albeit still a pretty diminuitive adze). 

I love that it mates with my transfer LT shovel blade!
review.name: Light and remarkably like a "real" axe

review.reviewBody: Lightweight, no frills solid piolet for spring ski missions
review.name: Solid

review.reviewBody: LOVE how light it is, plus pairing with the lightest UIAA rated shovel on the market?! *chefs kiss*
review.name: Ultralight ice axe

review.reviewBody: I got this pick for ski mountaineering, wanted it to be light but still trustworthy when it get icy. It is very light and you hardly feel it with the other avy gear, but it handles well in steep snow and feels robust.
review.name: light as can be

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love this thing. Incredibly light, but does the job as expected. Feels great in the hand, and it's compact size fits wonderfully on my touring packs.
review.name: Amazing new addition to the ice axe fam

name: Venom Light Classic Ice Axe

review.reviewBody: My second Giro Manifest helmet. Safety and comfort make it worth the price
review.name: Most comfortable helmet

review.reviewBody: Purchase this helmet after a bad crash and cracked my old helmet (a POC tectal race spin). It did a wonderful job protecting my melon; however, I always thought it didnâ€™t vent very well. Got the Giro and am very happy with it. Would highly recommend and appreciate the added safety features of this model.
review.name: Most comfortable helmet to date

review.reviewBody: Did the homework on the MTB helmet options. This one has great protection. There is no way to know what is the best but it is on the short list. Very comfy. A little bulky BUT thatâ€™s the trade off for protection.
review.name: Great protection and ventilation

review.reviewBody: Comfortable and light.
review.name: My favorite MTB helmet so far

review.reviewBody: Great helmet.  Comfortable so far with really good ventilation, however I have not used it for a full summer yet.  The Giro Manifest Spherical looks good and has very good adjustability.  No complaints so far.
review.name: Comfortable and cool

review.reviewBody: I ordered this because I wanted a new helmet. I chose the medium Matte Ano Orange.  It turned out to be the nicest, best fitting helmet I've owned. I worried about setting up my helmet mounted mirror because of the visor (which I really like), but it worked out perfectly.  The magnetic fasteners on the chin strap take some practice to get used to.
review.name: Best fitting and comfortable helmet

review.reviewBody: Great helmet.  Comfortable, looks great, and I'm sure it will protect my noggin' if I ever need it to do so.  Only gripe is the knob at the back can be hard to turn.
review.name: Awesome Helmet!

review.reviewBody: Quality is amazing and air vents are generous. It's saved my grape a couple of times. The only thing I would have liked is better sweat management. The inside pad doesn't do a very good job at keeping it out of your eyes.
review.name: Great mtb helmet

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this helmet. I understand that many people consider it expensive, but when I see bib shorts going for 180 to 280, I think spending 250 on something that will save your life - or quality of life - to be pretty reasonable. Mag closure is super easy once you figure it out. You feel like you're pressing buttons to release it, but really you're just sliding the magnet apart. Once you realize that, it will stop messing with your head! The fit is SO nice. I can see why it's often rated as the most comfortable helmet. Zero pressure points, zero wiggle. I'm so happy I bought it!
review.name: So comfortable

review.reviewBody: This helmet fits great it is very stylish. I really like the mag buckle as it?s easy to attach and detach. The vents are great for getting air over the noggin  It?s definitely on the pricey side but you get what you pay for.
review.name: Great Helmet

name: Manifest Spherical Mips Helmet
